instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SSD_RESET_L: What is SSD_RESET_L? SSD_RESET_L is a signal that puts the SSD in reset mode when it is low. This means the SSD will not be accessible when this signal is asserted.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not accept commands
threads.message: presents the folder with interrogation, I have already tested the external keyboard, disconnected the flats and used a Bios file ok, but without result.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not accept commands
threads.message:
Cannot access boot menu?
Did you try to boot USB macOS?
Is J9600 installed?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not accept commands
threads.message:
It is connected j9600.
The boot menu does not appear and when holding CMD + R it does not appear either. It is only on the INTERROGGATION PASTER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not accept commands
threads.message: Disconnect J9600 and try to boot through USB.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not accept commands
threads.message: same thing stays only in the INTERROGATION PASTE.I tested it with another keyboard and apartment. I disconnected the peripherals, but I didn't have a different result.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not accept commands
threads.message:
Check for short on SSD/NAND voltages.
Touchbar firmware is on SSD.

Still cannot access USB boot?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not accept commands
threads.message:
There is no SSD/NAND short in reference to the ground. 

Still cannot access USB boot?'' I cannot enter the boot menu.

I identified that <RESISTOR>R9350</RESISTOR> has 200k instead of 1.3M, replace with an equivalent, but I didn't get a result.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not accept commands
threads.message:
Post actual levels for <SIGNAL>STORAGE_LB_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_LB_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PD_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SSD_PCIE_CLKREQ_LB_L</SIGNAL>.
Be sure J9600 has good contacts.

<SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_LB_L</SIGNAL> 1.73V

<SIGNAL>PD_L</SIGNAL> 0.75V

<SIGNAL>SSD_PCIE_CLKREQ_LB_L</SIGNAL> 1.75V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not accept commands
threads.message: <SIGNAL>STORAGE_EN</SIGNAL> 143mV; <SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.3V;   <SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN_L</SIGNAL>  820mV; <SIGNAL>SSD_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL> 3.3V;  <SIGNAL>3V3_S5_SSD</SIGNAL>  766mV;

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not accept commands
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>3V3_S5_SSD</SIGNAL>  766mV"
Do you also miss <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_SSD_LB</SIGNAL>?
If yes, bad contact on J9600.
Be sure no short at <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_SSD_LB</SIGNAL> and then you can bypass J9600 with an wire.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not accept commands
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_SSD_LB</SIGNAL> is also missing. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_SSD_LB</SIGNAL> is not short in reference to ground.

"bypass J9600 with an wire" Sorry, I didn't mean what you meant by that.

I pull a wire to the j9600 from the pp3v3 mesh, how do I do that ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not accept commands
threads.message:
I suppose you get <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>; run a wire to <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_SSD_LB</SIGNAL>.
Try to understand a schematic, please...

I am with 11.09V <SIGNAL>PPVIN_2V7NAND_LB</SIGNAL>, is this value right ?

Post the corresponding signals from left side (in schematic).
